/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lzmq
hmm i updated VS build, which also includes libzmq, so this should compile fine - ahh, that was for sonic-sairedis build, swss has differnt configuration file, update here: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-build-tools/pull/162
retest vs please
retest vs please

23:04:57  [91mdpkg: dependency problems prevent configuration of swss:
23:04:57   swss depends on libzmq5 (>= 3.2.3+dfsg); however:
23:04:57    Package libzmq5 is not installed.
retest vs please

ok, something is wrong here:
17:45:59  + sudo apt-get install -y libzmq5 libzmq3-dev
17:46:00  Reading package lists...
17:46:00  Building dependency tree...
17:46:00  Reading state information...
17:46:00  libzmq5 is already the newest version (4.3.1-4+deb10u2).
17:46:00  libzmq5 set to manually installed.

18:00:08  Unpacking swss (1.0.0) over (1.0.0) ...
18:00:08  [91mdpkg: dependency problems prevent configuration of swss:
18:00:08   swss depends on libzmq5 (>= 3.2.3+dfsg); however:
18:00:08    Package libzmq5 is not installed.
18:00:08  
18:00:08  dpkg: error processing package swss (--install):
version seems different. likely the environment for building and testing are different, thus different libzmq versions are there.

17:46:00 libzmq5 is already the newest version (4.3.1-4+deb10u2).
18:00:08 swss depends on libzmq5 (>= 3.2.3+dfsg); however:
seems like this condition is met, but suggest taht swss was build against 3.2.3+dfsg)
still, the two version should be the same.
any idea how we can fix this ?

the issue is inside docker-sonic-vs, you do not have libzmq5 package installed. 

you need to install the libzmq5 package here. 

https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/blob/master/platform/vs/docker-sonic-vs/Dockerfile.j2#L50
great, added https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/5431
retest vs please

[teamsyncd]: Fix LAG add: write MTU configuration.

This was done on purpose for a use-case where kernel mtu is different from config_db mtu - https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1053.

> This was done on purpose for a use-case where kernel mtu is different from config_db mtu - #1053.

So how do you suggest to overcome this flow?
This is legal flow were warm boot is not working.

BTW why should we have MTU mismatch between kernel and config db. At some point the Linux direct command was not recommended and all should go via the config db.

Alibaba is ok with moving forward with closing this PR and tracking this change internally.

After merging this change, sonic will NOT support different MTU size between Kernel and ASIC.

Alibaba is ok with moving forward with closing this PR and tracking this change internally.

After merging this change, sonic will NOT support different MTU size between Kernel and ASIC.

This change will need to pass regular and warm reboot test.

Unit test can come with the master change. Please provide following logs with this change:

1. config reload configuration flow
2. swss restart configuration flow
3. first warm reboot configuration flow
4. subsequent warm reboot configuration flow
Issue: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/issues/1432
@prsunny done. Please check the issue.

This pull request **fixes 2 alerts** when merging 5af70dfb1ebd92abd85843b46d38fff4d293864e into e6fda3321427a94547c577900106b83be0d99335 - [view on LGTM.com](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/Azure/sonic-swss/rev/pr-c9b82195c77d7aa64c727c76b4d1fa9a9f04db05)

**fixed alerts:**

* 2 for Unused import
@prsunny Can you assign a reviewers for this issue ?

Found this comment explaining why it wasn't done 
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1159#discussion_r365480170

Since we need to have Signal Handlers in both the teammgrd and teamsyncd and both have resources to be cleaned up which are "interdependent", I found it is right to let the process continue and get killed by SIGKILL later. If we add explicit process exits, since they are exiting on their on pace, on testing I found some of the PortChannel interfaces remaining in the kernel and not getting cleaned.

@Sabareesh-Kumar-Anandan Can you please check that after your changes all PortChannel interfaces are being removed?

Thanks @pavel-shirshov -- yes that was what my observations during testing earlier. 

@Sabareesh-Kumar-Anandan You mention you still get the errors mentioned in PR comment -- after config reload ?

> Thanks @pavel-shirshov -- yes that was what my observations during testing earlier.
> 
> @Sabareesh-Kumar-Anandan You mention you still get the errors mentioned in PR comment -- after config reload ?

Yes. The errors mentioned in the PR are still seen after config reload.
I have observed teammgrd receives SIGTERM only after teamsyncd exits. Since teamsyncd continues till SIGKILL, teammgrd cleanup is not happening. So I added explicit process exits.
With this fix, all portchannel interfaces in kernel are cleaned up correctly. I tested multiple times and I dont see any issues.

@Sabareesh-Kumar-Anandan Can you please change your code 
`while (true) -> while (!received_signa)` and I'll approve your PR?

Hi @Sabareesh-Kumar-Anandan, I still don't get when you tell "all portchannel interfaces in kernel are cleaned up correctly" -- as we are calling TeamMgr::cleanTeamProcesses() and sync.cleanTeamSync() in respective signal handlers. It should be cleaned, unless even while doing a config reload you are creating portchannels !

Share your logs and steps you did....and the image you use We would need test with scale scenario as well.

After https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1159, we stopped seeing all issues you mentioned with teamsyncd/teammgrd . or any logs in our production environment. Need to make sure we don't introduce any issues again !

I did a quick check in one of the devices .. I see the interfaces getting cleaned in kernel and recreated on config reload. Need more info before proceeding !

It should be cleaned, unless even while doing a config reload you are creating portchannels !

> Share your logs and steps you did....and the image you use We would need test with scale scenario as well.

> After #1159, we stopped seeing all issues you mentioned with teamsyncd/teammgrd . or any logs in our production environment. Need to make sure we don't introduce any issues again !

@Sabareesh-Kumar-Anandan , I too find this behavior with the master branch. Looks like there is a change in behavior with the commit https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/commit/7158ccd30d81b6284214d4c8d570c22ddcff78a8, where in the process start/exit of teammgrd is sequenced after teamsyncd. So please go ahead with this fix after you take care of Pavel's comments. 

The branches 201811 and 201911 ( till 2 weeks back ) behaves correctly ( no behavior change as seen in master branch) with the teammgrd also getting the SIGTERM signal and cleaning up the Portchannel kernel resources correctly.
retest this please

Hi @lguohan ,
I see that for  'LGTM C++' analysis the build is failing (on 201911) with the same error for 2 month now:
`[2020-08-04 07:13:52] [build] fpmsyncd.cpp:3:10: fatal error: logger.h: No such file or directory
[2020-08-04 07:13:52] [build]     3 | #include "logger.h"
[2020-08-04 07:13:52] [build]       |          ^~~~~~~~~~`

1. How do we maintain past releases in working condition?
2. Can we manually retrigger LGTM analysis from github/WebGUI/without code change?
@daall Could you help review tests/test_fgnhg.py. There are some `time.sleep(1)`.
retest vs please
